results.definition: extending the legs at right angles to the trunk (one in front and the other in back)
a bottle containing half the usual amount
a promised or claimed share of loot or money
examples: he demanded his split before they disbanded
he inserted the wedge into a split in the log

results.definition: an opening made forcibly as by pulling apart
examples: there was a rip in his pants
she had snags in her stockings

results.definition: an old Croatian city on the Adriatic Sea
a dessert of sliced fruit and ice cream covered with whipped cream and cherries and nuts
(tenpin bowling) a divided formation of pins left standing after the first bowl
examples: he was winning until he got a split in the tenth frame

results.definition: an increase in the number of outstanding shares of a corporation without changing the shareholders' equity
examples: they announced a two-for-one split of the common stock

results.definition: the act of rending or ripping or splitting something
examples: he gave the envelope a vigorous rip

results.definition: division of a group into opposing factions
examples: another schism like that and they will wind up in bankruptcy
divide the cake into three equal parts
The British carved up the Ottoman Empire after World War I

results.definition: separate or cut with a tool, such as a sharp instrument
examples: cleave the bone

results.definition: discontinue an association or relation; go different ways
examples: The business partners broke over a tax question
The couple separated after 25 years of marriage
My friend and I split up

results.definition: go one's own way; move apart
examples: The friends separated after the party

results.definition: come open suddenly and violently, as if from internal pressure
examples: The bubble burst

results.definition: having been divided; having the unity destroyed
examples: Congress...gave the impression of...a confusing sum of disconnected local forces"-Samuel Lubell
a league of disunited nations"- E.B.White
a fragmented coalition
a split group

results.definition: (especially of wood) cut or ripped longitudinally with the grain
examples: we bought split logs for the fireplace
